summary: Catalog Management: Add New Book Title
description:
As a **Librarian**, I want to add new book titles to the catalog so that the collection is up-to-date with recent acquisitions.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Successfully adding a new title
Given I am logged in as a Librarian
And I am on the 'Catalog Management' page
When I input the Title 'Clean Code', Author 'Robert Martin', and ISBN '978-0132350884'
And I click 'Create Record'
Then the system should save the book details
And a success notification should appear
```

As a **Librarian**, I want to add specific physical copies to an existing book title so that we can track individual item availability.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Adding a physical copy to a title
Given a book title exists in the system
When I select 'Add Copy' and scan the unique asset barcode
Then the system increments the 'Total Quantity' for that title
And the new copy status is set to 'Available'
```

As a **Desk Staff**, I want to check out books to a patron so that the system records who has possession of the item.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Standard Check-out
Given the patron account is active and has no fines
When I scan the patron's ID and the book barcode
Then the system associates the book with the patron
And the due date is calculated based on loan rules
```

As a **Library Administrator**, I want to enforce a maximum loan limit of **5 books** per patron so that our inventory is distributed fairly among all members.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Reaching the limit
Given a patron already has 5 active loans
When I attempt to check out a 6th book for them
Then the system should block the transaction
And display an error message 'Loan limit reached (Max 5)'
```

As a **VIP Manager**, I want all patrons to have a maximum loan limit of **10 books** to encourage more reading volume.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Borrowing more books
Given a patron has 5 active loans
When I attempt to check out a 6th book
Then the system should allow the transaction
And the limit should be enforced only at 11 books
```

As an **Administrator**, I want to deactivate a patron's account instead of deleting it permanently so that we retain historical data for audit purposes.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Deactivating a user
Given I am viewing an active patron profile
When I toggle the status to 'Inactive'
Then the patron cannot log in
But their borrowing history remains in the database
```

As a **Library Manager**, I want to generate a monthly report of all overdue items so that we can estimate lost inventory costs.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Generating Report
Given I am on the Reporting Dashboard
When I select 'Overdue Analysis' and the current month
Then a PDF report is generated listing all items currently overdue by > 30 days
```

As a **System**, I want to send an automated email to patrons when a book is past its due date so that they are reminded to return it.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Sending overdue notice
Given it is 12:01 AM
And a book loan has become overdue
When the daily batch job runs
Then the system sends an email to the patron's registered address
```

As a **System**, I want to trigger an email notification to users who have late books so that they return items promptly.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Late book notification
Given a book is marked as overdue
When the system checks status
Then an email is dispatched to the user warning them of the delay
```

As a **User**, I want the interface to feel modern and cool so that I enjoy using the website more.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Checking the vibe
Given I open the homepage
When I look at the design
Then it should feel significantly better than the old version
```

As a **Researcher**, I want to filter search results by Genre, Publication Year, and Author simultaneously so that I can narrow down resources quickly.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Multi-faceted search
Given I have searched for 'History'
When I apply filters: Genre='War', Year='1900-1950'
Then the results list should only show books matching all criteria
```

As a **Mobile User**, I want to log in to the iOS Library App using FaceID so that I can access my account securely and quickly.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: FaceID Login
Given I have the iOS app installed
When I open the app and use FaceID
Then I should be authenticated without typing a password
```

As a **System**, I want to calculate a fine of $0.50 per day for each overdue book so that accurate debts are recorded.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Calculating fines
Given a book is returned 4 days late
When the check-in is processed
Then a fine of $2.00 is added to the patron's account
```

As a **Patron**, I want to pay my fines directly on the website using my Credit Card via Stripe so that I clear my debt instantly.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Paying with Card
Given I have a balance of $5.00
When I enter my VISA card details in the checkout modal
Then the payment is processed via Stripe API
And my library balance becomes $0.00
```

As a **Privacy Officer**, I want the system to permanently delete the link between a patron and a book immediately after the book is returned so that we protect user reading privacy.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Book Return Privacy
Given a patron returns a book
When the book status changes to 'Available'
Then the record of *who* borrowed that specific instance is hard-deleted
```

As a **Data Analyst**, I want to keep a 5-year history of all books borrowed by each patron so that we can build a recommendation engine based on their reading habits.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Data Retention
Given a patron returns a book
When the transaction is closed
Then the system stores the transaction log linked to the User ID for 5 years
```

As a **Security Admin**, I want the system to handle data securely so that we avoid any potential hacks or leaks in the future.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Security check
Given the system is online
When data is moved around
Then it should be safe and secure
```

As a **Librarian**, I want to edit existing book details (e.g., correct a typo in the title) so that the catalog remains accurate.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Editing a record
Given I am on the book detail page
When I change the title and click 'Update'
Then the database reflects the new title immediately
```

As a **Staff Member**, I want to update the metadata of a book, such as title or author, so that errors in the catalog are fixed.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Modifying metadata
Given I select a book to edit
When I update the author field and save
Then the system updates the book information in the catalog
```

As a **Patron**, I want to place a hold on a book that is currently checked out so that I am notified when it becomes available.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Placing a hold
Given the book is status 'Checked Out'
When I click the 'Place Hold' button
Then I am added to the queue for that title
```
